channel.title: Wedding of David and Emma Rappeport
channel.description: Recent content on Wedding of David and Emma Rappeport

item.title: The Rappeport Family
item.description: Rappeports Photo 1 - Photo taken at a wedding celebration hosted by Brenda and Scott for Emma and I at Oakledge in Sunapee, New Hampshire. My younger brother Eric was also there. Photo 2 - Eric and I after hiking Long’s Peak together in Estes Park, Colorado. ‚õ∞Ô∏è Photo 3 - Eric, Scott, Emma, and I at the annual Mt. Sunapee duck drop in October 2023.

item.title: The Fleming Family
item.description: Flemings Photo 1 - üéÑ Christmas with the Flemings. Grandpa Jim, Granny Rodina, Pauline Fleming, Emma’s older brother David Fleming, Emma Fleming 1, Emma Fleming 2, me, Claire Fleming. Also, the Flemings introduced me to Boxing Day, which is an amazing holiday!!! Photo 2 - Emma and Claire at David’s wedding. Photo 3 - Emma, Claire, Pauline, and Hugo walking in Brooklyn in early February 2024.

item.title: David Fleming
item.description: Emma’s Father Photo 1 - David and baby Emma building a sandcastle. Emma’s nickname has always been “Emma the Duck” because she looked like a little duckling as a baby. ü¶Üü¶Üü¶Ü. Photo 2 - Emma and her father, David Fleming, at a restaurant in San Diego, California. Photo 3 - David was an avid hiker and runner. This is a photo of Emma and David together on a hike in Oregon.

item.title: We eloped last year
item.description: So yes, we’re already married Photo 1 - Action shot with a view from the top of the courthouse in Santa Barbara, California. Photo 2 - In front of the courthouse minutes after getting married. Photo 3 - Holding hands while taking care of the wedding paperwork. Photo 4 - Me holding up the wedding contract as proof of a legal marriage contract. I couldn’t be more thrilled. ü•∞

item.title: Obviously she said yes.
item.description: üçæ üíç Photo 1 - üçæ Champagne toast üçæ at L’Auberge de Sedona right after my super secret amazing proposal. Photo 2 - Engagement photos on top of a mountain in Sedona the day after getting engaged. Photo 3 - Second photo from the same site of the photo shoot the day after our engagement.

item.title: Penny and Rhubarb Appreciation Photos
item.description: The Loves of our Lives Photo 1 - Penny and Rhubarb at Domino park at sunset. Photo 2 - Baby Rhubarb eating dinner with us at DOC wine bar next to our apartment in Williamsburg. Photo 3 - Baby Penny next to a statue in her likeness in Rittenhouse Square, Philadelphia. Photo 4 - Penny, Rhubarb, and Emma on Roosevelt Island during a summer picnic.

item.title: All our friends
item.description: Amazing people, Amazing memories Photo 1 - The view from mid mountain. Enjoying a mid day apres at La Flegere with Kelly, Marisa, Bariscan, and Brent. üá´üá∑ ü•ñ Photo 2 - Days after first moving to NYC from Philadelphia, Bariscan, Emma, and I at the finish of the Brooklyn Half Marathon. Photo 3 - Emma, Kelly, Jeff, and I. Kelly and Jeff spending the day with us in Brooklyn at Domino Park.

item.title: Sitting on a dock by the bay with you
item.description: Aspiring boat people Photo 1 - Sailing off the coast of Camden, Maine the day of my 30th birthday ‚õµ . Photo 2 - This photo was taken just after Emma and I completed our open water scuba diving ü§ø certification in the Florida Keys. Photo 3 - Sunset photo taken from the back of the Lake Sunapee Dinner Cruise boat. Photo 4 - An ocean pontoon ride (IYKYK) courtesy of our friends Sarah Noe and Dan Biscobing the day after their wedding in Hawaii.

item.title: She broadens my horizons
item.description: Traveling Photo 1 - Us in Ankor Wat, Cambodia üá∞üá≠ . This was our first international trip together. Photo 2 - Together on a hike in Zion National Park during the middle of Covid. Photo 3 - On a chairlift at Snowbird, Utah. Emma, always willing to try new things, took up skiing after first meeting me because she knew it was one of my great passions in life üíñ ‚õ∑Ô∏è.

item.title: Stand by me
item.description: Reaching new heights Photo 1 - Me and Emma at Emma’s law school graduation. Photo 2 - Emma and I celebrating after I completed my first marathon. In this photo, she’s equally proud of her sign as she is of me. Photo 3 - Us at the top of Mt. Washington, New Hampshire. This photo was taken on our second attempt at the summit.

item.title: I can tell that we are gonna be friends.
item.description: Date Nights Photo 1 - One of our very first dates together in Philadelphia. Who won at Jenga is still a contentious subject. ü§´ I won. Photo 2 - Date night overlooking the NYC skyline in Williamsburg New York. Photo 3 - Holiday night at with friend’s at Rolf’s NYC. ü§ê I originally bought this jacket for a Gomez and Morticia Adams halloween costume with Emma. Now its my favorite fancy night out outfit.

item.title: about
item.description: Eternity is a minimalist Hugo theme designed for portfolio sites with a fresh feel. This is demo site for Eternity theme. All images are taken from Unsplash. Features Configurable features. Multiple images support. Clean, fresh, minimalist. Integrated lazy load. Automatically creates resized thumbnails. Shows exif if it exists. Installation Install Hugo.

item.title: Honeymoon Fund
item.description: We are so happy you are joining us in Italy. Sharing this moment with you means the world to us. While we don’t have a registry, if you’d like to contribute to our honeymoon fund, we certainly won’t stop you. Grazie Mille!!

item.title: Wedding Week
item.description: Getting There Directions Gps Coordinates: East 43¬∞18‚Äô2.48‚Äù North 11¬∞12‚Äô17.61‚Äù From SIENA OVEST, follow the SS73 towards SOVICILLE. Go through COSTAFABBRI, COSTALPINO and on to VOLTE BASSE. Immediately after the small village of Volte Basse, turn right towards Sovicille (SP37). Once in Sovicille, at the roundabout, take the third exit and turn right to continue in the direction of Ancaiano (SP52). Shortly before entering the village of Ancaiano, turn right along a dirt road with signs to CETINALE and CELSA.
